result.execSummary:
The defendant LeRoy T. Parmeter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. LeRoy T. Parmeter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • LeRoy T. Parmeter was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
May request early discharge from Probation.  
Must report to Probation today.

miscConds.notes: Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
Cannot vote until civil rights are restored.
May not hold elective office.
Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
If not a US citizen may face deportation.
Compas and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Conditional Time stayed for use by Probation or use as ATR if necessary.

supervisions.notes: $250.00 DNA surcharge will be reduced to a civil judgment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LeRoy T. Parmeter

records.addlTxt:
Defendant LeRoy T. Parmeter in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Defendant LeRoy T. Parmeter in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:15 pm.  
126 days PCJ = time served.  Remaining $ owing is reduced to civil judgment.  PCR.  1:26 pm adj.

9:04  2 CASES:  14CF280 & 16CF113.   Defendant LeRoy T. Parmeter in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  Per Atty Biller 16CF113 ready to resolve w/plea.  Confusion on 14CF280 case, was not sure he had been appt.  Requesting Ct to set Sent. after Rev. on that file.  Ct takes judical notice of 14CF280.  

16CF113 - DE pleads G to Count 2, Ct accepts.  Repeater due to 14CF280.  Counts 1 & 3 will be dismissed and read in.  VR complied with.  No Firearm.   Ct finds DE FVI&K enters plea.  Judgment of G enter.  Remainder counts read in @ sentencing, read in, dismissed w/o costs.  SENTENCING: Qualifies for boot camp.  Ct -  w/h sentence, 3 years prob., request for early discharge ct will sign.   DNA sample surcharge of $250.00.  Fines/costs of $290.60.  Both payable to probation.  If not paid by end of probation, can be turned into a civil judgment.  9:36 adj.
Sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on June 7, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Mark Biller
from DOC to Judge Anderson re request for conditional jail time.  GRANTED 7/6/15.

CASES: 14CF253, 14CF280 & 14CF423. Defendant LeRoy T. Parmeter in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:39 pm. 
14CF423-Dismissed.  14CF253-Dismissed.  14CF280 counts 2,3 & 4-Dismissed. 
14CF280-Count 1-guilty.  CT accept plea, adj guilty.  
CT finds waiver of PSI.  
SENTENCE:  w/h sentence, probation up to 2 yrs, can ask for early discharge.  COMPAS & follow recommendations.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  Waiving court costs.  Find 2 days sentence credit.  6 mo CT, stayed for use by probation or use as ATR if necessary.  Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Must report to probation today.  PCR.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elective office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation.  2:02 pm adj.
Plea hearing on December 11, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
